subject: RE: [junit] UI testing am I being lazy?
msgSnippet: ... Ah... so attainFooOptimality is a little factory somewhere that happens to produce the Foo I am interested in - and I TDD not so much the implementation of
messageBody:
Thomas L Roche wrote:

> Therefore I'm suggesting that you might want to consider if it's worth
> the effort to

>>> 4) expose API to getEffectDesired()

> write some expressive, relatively-atomic API, e.g.
> attainFooOptimality(...) that does what your UI wanted, and does
> it correctly (darn those pesky DocumentListeners !-) This would
> presumably be reusable in future (or is foo-optimality some
> passing fancy?)

Ah... so attainFooOptimality is a little factory somewhere that happens to
produce the Foo I am interested in - and I TDD not so much the
implementation of attainFooOptimality, but the instance of Foo it returns.
Which is really what I should have TDD in the first place (the decoration of
existing DocumentListeners into the functionality I wanted).

Sometimes you just need to repeat the message over and over again until I
get it:)

Thanks

Bill
